Sub-theme for govCMS using the base theme and UI-Kit

This is a prototype boilerplate to aid the development of a sub-theme for govCMS using the DTA's UI-kit

In this section

  • What is this prototype?
  • How to use it
  • Base theme vs sub-theme
  • Boilerplate

What is this prototype?

This prototype is part of a govCMS sub-theme and exists as a playground for developing pages and layouts based on the base theme and UI-kit.

Find out more

The package contains:

  • This prototype with associated tooling; and
  • An associated govCMS theme with similar tooling

How to use it

The theme/prototype package can be used to suit your workflow. however, a proposed workflow is:

  1. Install it as a sub-theme within govCMS
  2. Reference the DTA Design Guide & UI-kit to discover the building blocks for prototyping.
  3. Build, test and deploy prototypes within /STARTERKIT/build
  4. Build, test and deploy the base theme within /STARTERKIT/*

Base theme vs sub-theme

This sub-theme/prototype relies upon the base theme (govCMS) and the UI-kit components within it.

The intent is to use:

  • the base theme for govCMS/UI-kit-only development/prototyping.
  • the sub-theme for customisation on top of the base theme without polluting it.

More information about the sub-theme development is available in README-FIRST.txt in the theme root.

Boilerplate

The UI-kit is not prescriptive with respect to boilerplating but instead provides modular components to permit easy site building.

Within this sub-theme prototype, you can boilerplate according your specific requirements.
